2018-10-28T18:56:48Z: Driver, TeamVerstappen, Red BullVettel, FerrariRaikkonen, Ferrari​Hamilton, MercedesBottas, MercedesHulkenberg, RenaultLeclerc, SauberVandoorne, McLarenEricsson, SauberGasly, Toro Rosso
2018-10-28T21:05:42Z: Here's our full report of the race that made Hamilton a five-time champion. Our next Live coverage will be of next weekend's Malaysian MotoGP Grand Prix, before F1 resumes in Brazil in a fortnight. Max Verstappen wins Mexican Grand Prix, Lewis Hamilton F1 championLewis Hamilton clinched his fifth Formula 1 title despite failing to finish on the podium in the Mexican Grand Prix, which was won by Max Verstappen
2018-10-28T21:01:38Z: But understandably he's not that fussed about today's low-key fourth place and returns to thanking his family, God and the team for everything that has brought him to this status of five-time F1 world champion.
2018-10-28T20:58:11Z: Hamilton sat in his cockpit for some time reflecting on what he's just achieved, but is now out and being congratulated by the Mercedes crew.
2018-10-28T20:56:54Z: Hamilton can't join the top three's parking area but there's a special 'world champion' parking board laid out for him. He does a couple of doughnuts then pulls up.
2018-10-28T20:54:57Z: No wild celebrations from Hamilton yet after that disappointing but extremely significant race. He waves to the crowd as he cruises around the slowing-down lap.
2018-10-28T20:54:34Z: Actor Will Smith comes on the Mercedes radio to give Hamilton his first congratulations on becoming a five-time F1 world champion.
2018-10-28T20:53:44Z: Outside the points: 11 Ocon; 12 Hartley; 13 Stroll; 14 Sirotkin; 15 Magnussen; 16 Grosjean
2018-10-28T20:53:19Z: Bottas has already finished in fifth, having finished a lap down.
2018-10-28T20:53:16Z: Result: 1 Verstappen; 2 Vettel; 3 Raikkonen; 4 Hamilton; 5 Bottas; 6 Hulkenberg; 7 Leclerc; 8 Vandoorne; 9 Ericsson; 10 Gasly
2018-10-28T20:53:07Z: Vettel failing to win means Hamilton doesn't even need to finish the race - but he does, in fourth place, and he is now a five-time world champion!
2018-10-28T20:52:33Z: It's a long wait for Hamilton, who was 1m14s off the lead at the start of the final lap.
2018-10-28T20:52:14Z: Vettel takes second, but it won't be enough to keep the world championship fight alive. Raikkonen completes the podium in third.
2018-10-28T20:51:39Z: Max Verstappen wins the Mexican Grand Prix again!
2018-10-28T20:51:27Z: Vettel asked for a gap update to the car behind (Raikkonen), and he's backed off completely now.
2018-10-28T20:50:24Z: Verstappen starts his final lap with a 15-second lead over Vettel.
2018-10-28T20:49:15Z: Near the back, Sirotkin has repassed Magnussen for 15th. Staying out forever on a first set of supersofts ended up not really working for Haas, which has had one of its worst weekends of the season.
2018-10-28T20:48:38Z: Perez's retirement and Ocon's frustrating day means Force India's hopes of getting back up to sixth in the constructors' now look a bit harder. This great eighth place Vandoorne's on course for will pull McLaren 15 points clear of its previously fast-closing rival and two races to go.
2018-10-28T20:47:18Z: Seventh and ninth for Leclerc and Ericsson at present would take Sauber past Toro Rosso into eighth in the constructors' championship, in what's currently the closest remaining battle in the teams' standings.
2018-10-28T20:45:59Z: This pace from Verstappen has increased his lead over Vettel to 14.9s.
2018-10-28T20:45:22Z: Verstappen puts in a 1m19.1s, but Bottas beats that again to take another fastest lap with a 1m18.7s.
2018-10-28T20:44:15Z: Bottas puts in the fastest lap on those hypersofts - 1m19.331s.
2018-10-28T20:43:59Z: Verstappen isn't turning himself down though - he puts in two fastest sectors but it's not quite a fastest lap with a 1m19.5s.
2018-10-28T20:42:28Z: Finally some progress for Ocon - he's passed Hartley for 11th. He's got a 2.3s gap to the Ericsson/Gasly battle ahead, can he salvage a point for Force India after all?
2018-10-28T20:42:13Z: Vettel is 14 seconds behind Verstappen after that VSC period, so if the Red Bull makes it to the end, it should be a comfortable run to the flag.
2018-10-28T20:41:51Z: Ricciardo's retirement will elevate his 2019 replacement Gasly into the points - and he's still all over the back of Ericsson and in with a chance of getting ninth from 20th on the grid.
2018-10-28T20:41:19Z: VSC ending, we are back to racing conditions.
2018-10-28T20:41:10Z: Grosjean has taken on some brand new hypersofts. He's not going to be able to achieve a lot with those with only seven laps left and a 25s gap to Sirotkin in 16th ahead.
2018-10-28T20:41:04Z: Bottas makes a third stop, taking a set of hypersofts to get him to the end.
2018-10-28T20:40:16Z: Grosjean, who was last anyway, comes into the pits.
2018-10-28T20:38:45Z: Virtual safety car for the Red Bull at the side of the track.
2018-10-28T20:38:33Z: Heartbreak for Ricciardo, who pulls off at Turn 1 and is out of the race. Red Bull loses its chance of a 1-2, and Vettel is now clear in second.
2018-10-28T20:37:56Z: Ricciardo's Red Bull has smoke starting to come out of the back of it!
2018-10-28T20:36:19Z: Ocon has had a miserable day since losing a chunk of front wing against a Renault on lap one. Only 13th now, he's being pressured by Stroll's Williams.
2018-10-28T20:35:24Z: 1 Verstappen, 2 Ricciardo +10.7s, 3 Vettel +12.0s, 4 Raikkonen +27.3s, 5 Hamilton +45.2s, 6 Bottas +1m03s.
2018-10-28T20:35:11Z: The midfield group's been spread out a bit as the leaders put more laps on them, but Gasly is continuing to provide the entertainment - now attacking Ericsson for 10th and the final point. That would be a great achievement having started last.
2018-10-28T20:34:32Z: Verstappen is getting away again now, 10s clear of Ricciardo and Vettel.
2018-10-28T20:34:08Z: The stewards have had a look at Gasly and Ocon's battle and decided there's nothing that requires any kind of penalty.
2018-10-28T20:33:12Z: Ricciardo does all he can to stay ahead of Vettel - posting a fastest lap of 1m19.462s.
2018-10-28T20:32:37Z: Ricciardo is told to open a gap in the high-speed corners where the Red Bull has an advantage over the Ferrari.
2018-10-28T20:32:19Z: This fight for second has helped Verstappen pull away slightly, so he leads by nine seconds now on lap 58/71.
2018-10-28T20:31:46Z: Ricciardo gets DRS from a Sauber, helping him defend from Vettel into Turn 1 and Turn 4.
2018-10-28T20:31:30Z: Leclerc in eighth has pulled out a little breathing space over pursuer Vandoorne.
2018-10-28T20:31:13Z: Gasly quickly passes Hartley too and is up to 11th. Next target is Ericsson in 10th, 2.4s ahead.
2018-10-28T20:30:51Z: The Ricciardo/Vettel battle is in traffic, which doesn't seem to be working out for the Red Bull again.
2018-10-28T20:30:24Z: Personal best of 1m19.7s for Verstappen, who knows he needs to keep an advantage in reserve in case Vettel gets past Ricciardo.
2018-10-28T20:29:58Z: The stewards are investigating an incident between Gasly and Ocon at Turn 4 during that tussle.
2018-10-28T20:29:38Z: Red Bull's best hope at the moment is if Vettel's ultrasofts give up the fight now he's in the dirty air of Ricciardo.
2018-10-28T20:29:09Z: Ocon's in strife with a Toro Rosso again - Gasly attacks and after an initial near-miss grabs 12th place.
2018-10-28T20:27:38Z: Vettel is just two seconds behind Ricciardo, who could play a big role in helping Verstappen win this race.
2018-10-28T20:25:53Z: Still looking good for Hulkenberg in seventh. His 'Class B' win is going to be slightly inherited - Sainz and Perez both retired while running ahead - but he's had everyone else under control and is 15s clear of Leclerc behind.
2018-10-28T20:25:20Z: Vettel is 7.5s behind Verstappen now, with Ricciardo just 1.6s ahead of him. Vettel will need to make quick work of the Aussie if he's to have a shot at Verstappen for the win over the final 19 laps.
2018-10-28T20:24:44Z: Mercedes isn't really in this race anymore. Hamilton and Bottas are 32s and 48s off the lead now. That's still enough for Hamilton to be crowned world champion today though, even if Vettel passes both Red Bulls to win.
2018-10-28T20:24:30Z: Gasly grabs 13th from Stroll. The Ericsson-Hartley-Ocon queue isn't far ahead now either.
2018-10-28T20:23:15Z: First bit of ground regained for Haas - Magnussen has passed Sirotkin for 15th.
2018-10-28T20:22:11Z: Vettel still fancies making a race of this - he pits in a fastest lap of 1m19.522s. He's only eight seconds behind Verstappen now, although Ricciardo is between them at the moment.
2018-10-28T20:22:09Z: Vandoorne is having a quietly strong race. He's now catching Leclerc for eighth.
2018-10-28T20:21:19Z: Verstappen is on new supersofts, Vettel new ultrasofts, Hamilton 5-lap-old ultrasofts, and Bottas 5-lap-old ultrasofts. Ricciardo and Raikkonen haven't made a second stop yet.
2018-10-28T20:20:41Z: Bottas comes in after his off-track excursion.
2018-10-28T20:20:21Z: Verstappen pits from the lead, responding to that stop from Vettel behind him. Sensible move from Red Bull to cover that.
2018-10-28T20:19:57Z: That was a replica of the Hamilton moment: Bottas was defending from Raikkonen, locked a wheel, and took to the grass.
2018-10-28T20:19:30Z: We have a Mercedes off at Turn 1 again - this time it's Bottas!
2018-10-28T20:19:12Z: Vettel pits from second, and Hamilton comes in as well.
2018-10-28T20:18:24Z: Hamilton rejoins behind the Red Bull, after a scary moment for the man trying to seal the world title today.
2018-10-28T20:18:02Z: Ricciardo attacks Hamilton, who defends into Turn 1, locks a brake, and goes for a trip through the grass!
2018-10-28T20:17:45Z: Grosjean rejoins 17th, so the two Haas cars are down to the last places. But they have fresh ultrasofts and everyone ahead is on very old supersofts, so there's scope to regain ground in the remaining 24 laps.
2018-10-28T20:17:16Z: No more fastest laps for Vettel, but he continues to take time out of Verstappen, and is 11.2s off the leader now.
2018-10-28T20:16:53Z: Grosjean has just been passed by Ericsson and is 11th, so with Magnussen having stopped you'd expect the other Haas to come in imminently. He does so.
2018-10-28T20:16:31Z: Ricciardo has DRS into Turn 1, but doesn't make an attempt. Is he waiting for Turn 4?
2018-10-28T20:16:20Z: Magnussen finally pits from ninth place, releasing Vandoorne after many laps trapped behind him. The Haas takes on ultrasofts but has fallen right back to 17th and last.
2018-10-28T20:15:50Z: Ricciardo has a look at Hamilton into Turn 4, and while Hamilton eventually opens the door to take the racing line, he's able to brake late enough to hang onto third place for now.
2018-10-28T20:15:31Z: Promoted: Play along with Pitstop Betting. The best odds and offers in Motorsport. Download the app today. T&Cs apply.
2018-10-28T20:14:05Z: Vettel takes another seven tenths out of Verstappen with a 1m20.1s, but the gap between them is still 12 seconds.
2018-10-28T20:12:58Z: Given that the Haas drivers are still going on their first set of supersofts after 43 laps, Renault must be feeling pretty chilled that seventh-placed Hulkenberg can get to the end without pitting again.
2018-10-28T20:12:14Z: Another fastest lap for Vettel - 1m20.260s - and he takes another half a second out of Verstappen.
2018-10-28T20:11:44Z: Hartley and Ocon's cars are both shedding small bits of bodywork after their clash. They continue in 13th and 14th, still chasing Ericsson, who is closing on the still-yet-to-pit Grosjean for 11th.
2018-10-28T20:11:30Z: Hamilton has no pace at the moment, and Ricciardo is reeling him back in for third.
2018-10-28T20:11:06Z: Perez looked devastated as he climbed out of the car - as you'd expect when you retire from your home grand prix while on course for the best result possible for your car.
2018-10-28T20:10:56Z: Fastest lap for Vettel: 1m20.263s. He takes another six tenths out of Verstappen's lead.
2018-10-28T20:10:11Z: More drama for Ocon as he bangs wheels with Hartley while attacking the Toro Rosso for 13th while it's trying to attack Ericsson for 12th.
2018-10-28T20:09:48Z: Vettel's last lap was 0.7s quicker than Verstappen. They're separated by 13.8 seconds on lap 41/71.
2018-10-28T20:09:42Z: Magnussen and Vandoorne are up to ninth and 10th with Perez's retirement.
2018-10-28T20:09:24Z: Perez's heartbreak now gives Hulkenberg a very clear run at the Class B win in seventh, with Leclerc in eighth 13s behind him.
2018-10-28T20:09:14Z: Raikkonen's strategy and fighting with Ricciardo and Hamilton before his first stop cost him a lot of time to Bottas earlier, but he's turned a 13-second deficit to the Mercedes into just 5.7 seconds now, in another battle where a Ferrari is outpacing a Mercedes. The silver cars don't look happy.
2018-10-28T20:09:03Z: Haas suggests that Perez's problem is his brakes.
2018-10-28T20:08:50Z: A replay shows Perez had a massive twitch into the first corner just before he slowed.
2018-10-28T20:08:36Z: Perez is definitely in trouble, he's plunging down the order and lapping slowly. He brings the car into the pits.
2018-10-28T20:07:49Z: That might've been a mistake or problem for Perez, he's falling down the order on the timing screen and is now 12th behind the Haas pair and Vandoorne.
2018-10-28T20:07:42Z: Ricciardo's pace hasn't been up to much since he lost out to Vettel - he's 5.7s behind Hamilton now.
2018-10-28T20:07:18Z: Hamilton moves to the inside to try to cover the line into Turn 1, but there's nothing he can do to stop the Ferrari coming through, and Vettel takes second from the world champion-in-waiting.
2018-10-28T20:06:56Z: Leclerc gets back past Perez and reclaims eighth - didn't see that coming given how fresh the Force India's tyres are.
2018-10-28T20:06:38Z: Vettel is now just half a second behind Hamilton, and he's got DRS.
2018-10-28T20:06:23Z: As Vettel closes on Hamilton, Verstappen is now 14 seconds up the road. If there are any strategic surprises to come in this race, the leader has a comfortable gap to work with to be able to respond to whatever happens behind him.
2018-10-28T20:05:04Z: Vettel was a second quicker than Hamilton last time around - the gap is down to 1.4s.
2018-10-28T20:03:55Z: Vettel's charge continues - he's now just 2.3s behind Hamilton and closing.
2018-10-28T20:03:48Z: 'Class B' order: 7 Hulkenberg; 8 Perez; 9 Leclerc; 10 Magnussen; 11 Vandoorne; 12 Grosjean; 13 Ericsson; 14 Hartley; 15 Ocon; 16 Stroll; 17 Sirotkin; 18 Gasly
2018-10-28T20:03:18Z: Sirotkin has lost out badly since that VSC restart. Hartley, Ocon and Stroll have all passed him and he's down to 17th with just Gasly behind.
2018-10-28T20:02:53Z: Haas pair Magnussen and Grosjean still haven't pitted at all and remain 10th and 12th. Vandoorne recently got between them and Ericsson is catching Grosjean fast, but this just-plug-on strategy isn't working badly at all.
2018-10-28T20:01:54Z: Perez now attacks Leclerc again, getting a run and going right around the outside at Turn 1 to take eighth place. He's now 14s behind Hulkenberg in seventh but the Renault may well need to pit again.
2018-10-28T20:01:30Z: Amid all that, Perez still hasn't quite managed to pass Leclerc for eighth - the Sauber coming back at him when the Force India nosed ahead.
2018-10-28T20:00:26Z: Vettel dives for the inside at Turn 1, Ricciardo tries to hold him off, but the Ferrari gets the job done! Vettel's up to third.
2018-10-28T19:59:58Z: Ricciardo gets held up behind the Leclerc/Perez battle in the final sector, and Vettel's got a chance...
2018-10-28T19:59:53Z: Perez is right behind eighth-placed Leclerc after that pitstop and attacking. If Hulkenberg has to pit again from seventh - and he's trying to do 40-odd laps on his supersofts - Perez is in great shape.
2018-10-28T19:58:54Z: Ricciardo responds well to the return to racing conditions, and avoids being jumped by Vettel. He then gets a good enough exit from the final corner to prevent an attack into Turn 1.
2018-10-28T19:58:03Z: And the VSC ends, back to green flag racing.
2018-10-28T19:57:49Z: Sainz's car is cleared, so we'll soon be back to full racing conditions.
2018-10-28T19:57:38Z: Ocon also made another pitstop during the VSC, grabbing ultrasofts and rejoining 16th. He's been out of sequence since his first lap front wing damage.
2018-10-28T19:56:44Z: Perez swaps to ultrasofts and he rejoins ninth behind Hulkenberg and Leclerc.
2018-10-28T19:56:37Z: Vettel is all over the back of Ricciardo under VSC - he'll be looking to get the jump on the Red Bull when we go back to green.
2018-10-28T19:56:26Z: Perez dives in for his first and probably only pitstop from seventh.
2018-10-28T19:56:14Z: Sainz's retirement means Hulkenberg moves up to eighth and Leclerc to ninth.
2018-10-28T19:55:31Z: Sainz had led Class B in the first stint and was now second in it behind Perez following his early stop to get rid of hypersoft. Looks like a mechanical problem and he had to immediately park.
2018-10-28T19:54:58Z: Sainz's stranded car prompts another VSC.
2018-10-28T19:54:51Z: Sainz has pulled off and retired - he was running eighth.
2018-10-28T19:54:40Z: Ricciardo has the help of DRS from backmarkers to help him defend from Vettel, who has a bit of a look around the outside into Turn 4. Ricciardo fends off the attack, but without DRS there, there's every chance Vettel would have breezed past him.
2018-10-28T19:53:38Z: Vettel has closed back up on Ricciardo with the help of a train of backmarkers.
2018-10-28T19:53:10Z: Even with Red Bull trying to control his pace, Verstappen is still a full second quicker than Hamilton.
2018-10-28T19:51:44Z: That message to Verstappen might just have been a reminder to keep some pace and tyre life in reserve. He was 1.2s quicker than Hamilton last time around.
2018-10-28T19:51:06Z: Gasly comes in from 15th to make his second stop. He pitted very early to get rid of the hypersofts he started on. He swaps to more supersofts and rejoins 19th and last.
2018-10-28T19:50:13Z: Leclerc's charge continues as he passes the yet-to-pit Magnussen for 10th. There's a 6.7s gap to Hulkenberg ahead now, though.
2018-10-28T19:49:58Z: Meanwhile at the front, Verstappen's blissful lead is almost up to 10 seconds now.
2018-10-28T19:49:54Z: In the battle for the best of the rest honours, Perez is still out on his original set of supersofts and he's keeping a steady 3-4s gap over Sainz behind.
2018-10-28T19:49:38Z: Hamilton is promised a tyre/strategy update in 10 laps' time, but he is told that his tyre 'appearance' is similar to those around him.
2018-10-28T19:48:56Z: Hairy pitstop for Stroll, a replay shows one of the front tyre changes was only just completed as the car was released and a mechanic fell to the ground. They got up looking OK.
2018-10-28T19:48:47Z: Ricciardo flags up some front tyre concerns, and is reminded that he needs to look after this set. He's told that the cars that started on the supersoft tyre had a difficult phase of graining, but their tyres did clear up later in the stint. Some reassurance, perhaps.
2018-10-28T19:47:57Z: Despite his struggles, Hamilton is keeping Ricciardo pegged at two seconds back. The man on the move is Vettel, who is catching both of them and is 1.6s behind the Red Bull now.
2018-10-28T19:47:49Z: Stroll makes a second pitstop, as does Hartley - who came in at the end of the first lap.
2018-10-28T19:46:22Z: Mercedes tells an unhappy Hamilton that the only option he has for a tyre change is another set of ultrasofts, and Hamilton is reminded that that didn't go too well in the first stint.
2018-10-28T19:45:15Z: More encouragement on the radio for Ricciardo, who is told that Hamilton isn't happy with his tyres. Ricciardo is 2.1s behind the Mercedes at the moment, and Red Bull would quite like a 1-2 today.
2018-10-28T19:42:00Z: Grosjean's lack of pace in 12th is such that the Williams of Stroll and Sirotkin are now catching the long queue behind him.
2018-10-28T19:41:45Z: 1 Verstappen, 2 Hamilton +8.8s, 3 Ricciardo +11.3s, 4 Vettel +13.6s, 5 Bottas +18.5s, 6 Raikkonen +32.1s.
2018-10-28T19:40:45Z: Ricciardo has slipped back to 2.2s behind Hamilton, since they both cleared Raikkonen.
2018-10-28T19:40:44Z: The only drivers yet to pit at all so far are Perez in seventh, Magnussen in 10th and Grosjean in 12th.
2018-10-28T19:40:15Z: Those first stops for the leaders took place earlier than any of the teams would have really liked, so we could be on for two-stop strategies here. It wouldn't be a surprise to see someone gamble on trying to make it to the end without another stop, but it seems unlikely that all six of the leaders will make it from here with these supersofts.
2018-10-28T19:40:11Z: Haas hasn't had great pace all weekend and though Grosjean is up to 12th having not pitted, he's got Hartley, Ocon, Gasly and Vandoorne all queued up behind him in a feisty train.
2018-10-28T19:39:39Z: Ericsson fell a long way behind fellow Q3 hypersoft starters Sainz, Hulkenberg and Leclerc in the opening stint and then stayed out later than them. It hasn't worked well - he rejoined 19th and is now the first car to be lapped.
2018-10-28T19:38:26Z: Verstappen leads Hamilton by eight seconds now the race has settled down again at the front.
2018-10-28T19:38:24Z: Leclerc is hacking back through the cars on the alternative strategy after pitting to switch from hypersofts to supersofts. His latest victim is Grosjean and he's up to 11th.
2018-10-28T19:37:29Z: Both Ferraris pit on the same lap, so Verstappen leads the race again.
2018-10-28T19:37:09Z: Credit has to be given to Raikkonen there for spotting Hamilton coming at the last moment and making sure he left a little bit of room at the apex. It wasn't the most committed move we've ever seen from Hamilton.
2018-10-28T19:36:28Z: Hamilton has a look at Raikkonen - somewhat half-hearted - but he manages to properly get alongside in Turn 2, complete the pass in Turn 3, and Ricciardo slips past the Ferrari as well.
2018-10-28T19:35:03Z: Now it's Hamilton's turn to close up on Raikkonen. Can he make quick work of the Ferrari like Verstappen did, or will he be more careful with a championship on his mind? He's got Ricciardo for company now as well...
2018-10-28T19:34:44Z: Sainz clears Ericsson and is up to eighth. The Renault took on supersofts at its stop and is 2.8s behind new Class B leader Perez, who is yet to stop and is using the supersofts he started the race with.
2018-10-28T19:33:36Z: Verstappen gets DRS down the main straight, and he makes relatively light work of the Ferrari. He's up to second, and now has some clear track ahead of him with Vettel 12 seconds up the road.
2018-10-28T19:33:13Z: Sainz has just cleared the yet-to-stop Magnussen for ninth and is now attacking Ericsson for eighth.
2018-10-28T19:32:59Z: Verstappen is crawling all over the back of Raikkonen through the stadium section.
2018-10-28T19:32:51Z: Perez successfully attacks Ericsson and takes seventh - which gets a suitably noisy reaction from the Mexican crowd.
2018-10-28T19:32:47Z: Vettel says his tyres are going off, but he's going to try to stay out.
2018-10-28T19:32:32Z: Leclerc moves onto supersofts and rejoins 15th, with his first-stint Class B rivals Sainz and Hulkenberg still ahead in ninth and 12th.
2018-10-28T19:32:30Z: Verstappen has rejoined just behind Raikkonen, so it shouldn't be long before he gets past the Ferrari. Then again, we said that when Hamilton caught Raikkonen on fresh tyres last week.
2018-10-28T19:32:01Z: Now we have a Ferrari 1-2. Will Vettel and Raikkonen stay out to do something different?
2018-10-28T19:32:00Z: Leclerc pits from seventh, having opened out a handy gap of 8s to team-mate Ericsson behind.
2018-10-28T19:31:31Z: Ericsson is still out on hypersofts and up to eighth, with Perez, Magnussen and the already-pitted Sainz all over him. Vandoorne just pitted out of this group.
2018-10-28T19:31:24Z: Now Verstappen pits, as Red Bull plays for track position.
2018-10-28T19:31:07Z: Hamilton is 24.6 seconds off the lead.
2018-10-28T19:30:39Z: Bottas cruises past Leclerc to reclaim sixth.
2018-10-28T19:30:26Z: Ricciardo is the next man to stop, coming in a lap after Hamilton and Bottas. The Red Bull rejoins behind the Mercedes.
2018-10-28T19:30:22Z: Hulkenberg pits from seventh place now.
2018-10-28T19:29:52Z: Bottas rejoins between the two Saubers in eighth after that stop.
2018-10-28T19:29:37Z: Hamilton emerges in fifth from that stop. Will Red Bull or Ferrari respond to those early stops from the Silver Arrows?
2018-10-28T19:29:22Z: Sainz pits from the lead of 'Class B' in seventh place, falling to 13th and rejoining on supersofts.
2018-10-28T19:29:00Z: Perez is now working very, very hard to pass Ericsson for 10th place - to no avail yet.
2018-10-28T19:28:55Z: Hamilton is the first of the leaders to pit, taking supersofts. And Bottas is in on the same lap! Fine work from Mercedes.
2018-10-28T19:28:43Z: Stroll makes his first pitstop, switches to ultrasofts and rejoins behind fellow early-stopper Gasly at the tail of the field.
2018-10-28T19:27:56Z: Crucially, Ricciardo didn't have that gap to Hamilton under one second before the DRS detection zone for the main straight. It's a matter of time now though before he has the benefit of being able to open his rear wing up.
2018-10-28T19:27:09Z: Ricciardo has responded to that message from Red Bull by increasing the pressure on Hamilton, closing to 0.9s behind the Mercedes now.
2018-10-28T19:26:02Z: Eight seconds covers the top four, while Bottas and Raikkonen are 13-14 seconds off the lead already.
2018-10-28T19:25:38Z: Verstappen's lead is up to three seconds now, while Hamilton has edged his advantage over Ricciardo out to 1.8 seconds.
2018-10-28T19:23:16Z: Home favourite Sergio Perez is only 11th right now but he's in good shape - running supersofts and right on hypersoft-shod Marcus Ericsson's tail with three other hypersoft starters not far ahead.
2018-10-28T19:22:28Z: Ricciardo is 1.5s behind Hamilton, it'll be interesting to see if the second Red Bull can make the Mercedes driver's afternoon a bit more challenging.
2018-10-28T19:21:38Z: Gasly swaps his hypersofts for supersofts and rejoins 19th, at the back of the field.
2018-10-28T19:21:35Z: Nothing gained or lost in the lead battle during that VSC. Verstappen and Hamilton resume racing still two seconds apart, meaning they both read the sector guidelines on their steering wheels to perfection.
2018-10-28T19:21:06Z: Gasly dives into the pits from 16th.
2018-10-28T19:20:28Z: Replays show Ocon clouted Hulkenberg and his front wing went flying, with Alonso running over it and going wide. Not sure yet if that caused Alonso's retirement as there was also smoke from the McLaren before it stopped.
2018-10-28T19:20:18Z: And the track is clear and racing can fully resume.
2018-10-28T19:19:28Z: The virtual safety car is out so Alonso's car can be moved.
2018-10-28T19:19:11Z: Verstappen's lead is up to a comfortable two seconds already.
2018-10-28T19:18:59Z: Alonso is stopping and retiring - it looked like he'd picked up a chunk of bodywork from Ocon's Force India on lap one.
2018-10-28T19:18:38Z: Magnussen brakes too late into the first corner as he battles with Stroll and scoots over the grass. He skitters back on and gives the place to the Williams, staying 14th.
2018-10-28T19:17:12Z: Order: 1 Verstappen; 2 Hamilton; 3 Ricciardo; 4 Vettel; 5 Bottas; 6 Raikkonen; 7 Sainz; 8 Hulkenberg; 9 Leclerc; 10 Ericsson; 11 Perez; 12 Alonso; 13 Stroll; 14 Magnussen; 15 Sirotkin; 16 Gasly; 17 Vandoorne; 18 Grosjean; 19 Hartley; 20 Ocon
2018-10-28T19:16:40Z: Verstappen leads Hamilton by 1.5 seconds. That'll do nicely for the Mercedes driver at the moment.
2018-10-28T19:16:21Z: The top four have already broken away - Verstappen, Hamilton, Ricciardo, Vettel.
2018-10-28T19:16:06Z: Bottas ran out of road at Turns 4-5 on the opening lap, which is how he ended up having to shuffle in behind Vettel after a promising first few corners.
2018-10-28T19:15:17Z: Ocon pits for repairs from that first-lap incident, and Hartley has come in too. Both rejoin quickly.
2018-10-28T19:15:08Z: Raikkonen passes Sainz around the outside into Turn 1, so the usual Class A/B split between the top six and the rest is restored.
2018-10-28T19:14:45Z: Crucial start for Red Bull then, getting one of its cars into the lead by the first sequence of corners.
2018-10-28T19:14:22Z: Bottas briefly gets a look at Ricciardo for third, but he's been shuffled back behind Ricciardo and Vettel and is fifth, just ahead of Raikko - no! Sainz is sixth.
2018-10-28T19:13:46Z: Fernando Alonso looks like he's picked up damage, as has Esteban Ocon.
2018-10-28T19:13:45Z: But Verstappen comes back at Hamilton, and takes the lead into Turn 1!
2018-10-28T19:13:23Z: Rocket start from Hamilton who drives between the Red Bulls off the line!
2018-10-28T19:12:44Z: Ok, the cars are lining up. Here we go...
2018-10-28T19:12:10Z: It's a fast formation lap from the Red Bulls, they've really strung the field out.
2018-10-28T19:10:45Z: Ricciardo leads the field away for the formation lap - it's all calm for just another minute or so.
2018-10-28T19:10:03Z: The mechanics clear the grid, and the cars sit, engines running, awaiting clearance to set off for the formation lap.
2018-10-28T19:08:36Z: Most of the pre-race talk has been about the run to the first corner. The long straight and the power of the tow here means that even if Red Bull had a stronger engine, its cars would be vulnerable at the start. Christian Horner has talked of coming up with a plan for Ricciardo and Verstappen to block the road, but the track is a bit wide for that. There's every chance we'll have a Mercedes or a Ferrari in the lead at the first corner, and the two drivers most likely to achieve that are second-row starters Hamilton and Vettel.
2018-10-28T19:06:14Z: Remember, for Vettel, anything but victory here today and his title hopes are over.
2018-10-28T19:02:36Z: So what's your favourite storyline heading into this race? Red Bull's first front row lockout since 2013, and its chances of battling Mercedes and Ferrari in a straight fight, is up there with the prospect of Lewis Hamilton becoming a 5-time world champion. The title race seems an inevitability, so let's hope the convergence of engine performance at high altitude here means we are treated to a proper six-car race for victory, whatever happens with Hamilton and Sebastian Vettel.
2018-10-28T19:00:16Z: Welcome to live coverage of the 2018 Mexican Grand Prix.
